result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald J Burton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Crime against an Elderly or Disabled Person], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Pay  Court costs, all applicable surcharges and assessments.  All to be collected out of cash bail on deposit.
Obtain/maintain fulltime employment or attend school.  Obtain GED or HSED.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Anthony J., Lisa P. and Patricia P.
No medications without a valid prescription.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision.
Pay all supervision fees.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

timeConds.notes: Forthwith.  Straight time.  No good time credit.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order denying request for release privileges.  Court intended the defendant to serve the condition time without release privileges.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for Huber and transfer to Washington County.
Bail Refund Packet
5/4/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Gerald J Burton in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, with credit for 41 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
-Restitution set at $0   
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected out of cash bail on deposit.  
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge out of cash bail on deposit.   Any remaining balance to be returned to person who posted.  
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment or attend school
-Obtain GED or HSED
-No contact with Anthony J., Lisa P. and Patricia P. 
-No medications without a valid prescription
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service
-As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 6 MONTHS, straight time,  in the House of Corrections, forthwith.  Defendant taken into custody.  No good time credit.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Defendant Gerald J Burton in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Ron Dague for  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gerald J Burton in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Gerald J Burton in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Gerald J Burton not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for Patrick Anderson for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Based on a report dated 8/26/2015 from Dr. Lundbohm Court orders inpatient treatment for restoration of competency.  There are no challenges to the report from the State,   defense, the Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent.  The proceedings are suspended.  The defendant is commited on 9/10/2015 to the Department of Health and Family Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  DHFS shall designate the mental health institute.  The sheriff shall transport the defendant to and from the designated institute.  The institute shall periodically re-examine the defendant and furnish written reports to the court.
Order of commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.
Court cancels the 9/29/15 return on doctor's report hearing.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Return on warrant scheduled for 09-10-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Gerald J Burton not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for return on warrant in Branch 19.
Clerk:  jms
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

There are no appearances.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Based on the letter dated 8/26/15 from the Outpatient Competency Restoration Program Court Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  No bail is forfeited at this time.

from Brooke E. Lundbohm, Psy.D. dated July 20, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Gerald J Burton in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Competency Hearing proceeded.  State and defense do not challenge Dr. Rawski report.    Court ordered competency to be restored with the Outpatient Restoration Program.  Order signed and filed.  Case adjourned for return on doctors report.
  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Gerald J Burton in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for return on doctors report, however defenserequests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Forensic Report received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.

Defendant Gerald J Burton in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas Potter for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for scheduling conference and bail review.  Defense no longer wishes to address bail.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Forensic evaluation will take place the Wisconsin Forensic Unit, Room 504 of the Safety Building with Dr. Rawski on 06/02/2015 at 12:30pm. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gerald J Burton in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Gerald J Burton in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Defense Counsel requests sequestration of all State's witnesses.  Sworn for the state:Michael Mattioli-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court. Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO REDUCE BAIL.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Anthony J(victim); Pat and Lisa P ( eyewitnesses) or their residence.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gerald J Burton in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Gerald J Burton in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner Orders the Sheriff Department to collect DNA from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
